title: Segfault in _cext.compute_expectations for CatBoost model with categorical features
body:
The error is a segfault, that's causing the Python interpreter to crash. This error is intermittent on my local MacOs laptop, but seems to happen 100% of the time when running on a Linux VM (both have 32gb of RAM). I did eventually find a workaround (see below).

The script that triggers the segfault:

```
import faulthandler; faulthandler.enable()  # to trace the segfault

explainer = shap.Explainer(catboost_model)
```

The CatBoost model is ~600mb, trained on a mix of categorical and numerical features, (I'm not able to share it).

Trace of the error:

```bash
Current thread 0x00000001052ec580 (most recent call first):
  File "/Users/bob/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/project-2Qds--Dr-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 1382 in __init__
  File "/Users/bob/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/project-2Qds--Dr-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 1675 in get_trees
  File "/Users/bob/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/project-2Qds--Dr-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 962 in __init__
  File "/Users/bob/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/project-2Qds--Dr-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 149 in __init__
  File "/Users/bob/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/project-2Qds--Dr-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_explainer.py", line 187 in __init__
  File "run_shap.py", line 28 in <module>
zsh: segmentation fault 
```

The above stack trace tells us the segfault is occurring in the C++ function, `_cext.compute_expectations`, called [here](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/45b85c1837283fdaeed7440ec6365a886af4a333/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L1375). (Note the line numbers are slightly off because I added print statements...)

Versions:
```
catboost==1.0.5
shap==0.41.0
python==3.8.13
```

### A workaround/fix

I found that the function where the segfault is occurring, `_cext.compute_expectations`, doesn't actually need to run for a CatBoost model with categorical features.

In fact, [this](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/45b85c1837283fdaeed7440ec6365a886af4a333/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L956) block expects an exception to be raised in the case of a CatBoost model with categorical features. The problem is that instead of an exception being raised, a segfault is occurring, that's killing the whole program.

My workaround was to monkeypatch [CatBoostTreeModelLoader](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/45b85c1837283fdaeed7440ec6365a886af4a333/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L1593) to raise an exception immediately; which takes us to the [except](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/45b85c1837283fdaeed7440ec6365a886af4a333/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L960) block that we were meant to go to, and prevents `_cext.compute_expectations` from being called. I've found that this solves the issue for the models we are running this on.

(Perhaps the `shap` codebase could check whether a CatBoost model has categorical features, instead of running the try except/block?)

A problem with this fix is that it's specific to CatBoost, but the issue might come up with other types of model that try to run `_cext.compute_expectations`. Also, I guess it would be good to be able to run this branch of the code in the case of a CatBoost model trained on only numerical features?

### Speculation about the problem

I wonder if there could be a memory management issue in the C++ code?
